title: 106_s2310
content: The "Firearms Dealer Penalty Flexibility Act of 2000" allows for the suspension of a firearms dealer's license and imposes civil penalties. Section 923 of title 18, United States Code, is amended to allow the Secretary to suspend or revoke a license or impose civil penalties up to $10,000 for willful violations of firearm regulations. This includes transferring armor-piercing ammunition and the ability to compromise or mitigate liability for violations. The Secretary has the authority to suspend or revoke a license, or impose civil penalties up to $10,000 for willful violations of firearm regulations. The affected party must be provided with written notice stating the grounds for denial, revocation, suspension, or assessment of a civil penalty. The holder of a license must receive notice before the effective date of revocation or suspension. The Secretary has the authority to suspend or revoke a license, or impose civil penalties for violations of firearm regulations. If the Secretary denies an application or revokes/suspends a license, a hearing can be requested for review. If the decision is not reversed after the hearing, the aggrieved party will be notified. The Secretary can suspend or revoke a license for firearm regulation violations. If the decision is not reversed after a hearing, the aggrieved party can file a petition for judicial review within 60 days. The court can consider any evidence submitted by the parties in the proceeding. The court can order the Secretary to comply with its judgment if it decides the denial, revocation, suspension, or assessment was unauthorized. The Secretary must stay the effective date of any suspension, revocation, or assessment upon request pending an appeal. SEC. 3. TERMINATION OF FIREARMS DEALER'S LICENSE UPON FELONY CONVICTION. Amends Section 925(b) of title 18, United States Code, to change the wording regarding the termination of a firearms dealer's license upon felony conviction.
